params.name: config
params.description:
This is the main configuration for your BrowserSync instance and can contain any of the [available options]({{site.links.options}})
 If you do not pass a config an argument for configuration, BrowserSync will still run; but it will be in the `snippet` mode

params.name: cb
params.description:
If you pass a callback function, it will be called when BrowserSync has completed all setup tasks and is ready to use. This
is useful when you need to wait for information (for example: urls, port etc) or perform other tasks synchronously.

classitems.description: The `reload` method will inform all browsers about changed files and will either cause the browser to refresh, or inject the files where possible.
classitems.name: reload

params.name: arg
params.description:
The file or files to be reloaded. For
details and examples of Streams support, please see the [GulpJS]({{site.links.gulp}}) examples

classitems.description: A simple true/false flag that you can use to determine if there's a currently-running BrowserSync instance.
classitems.name: active

params.name: msg
params.description: Can be a simple message such as 'Connected' or HTML

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long the message will remain in the browser. @since 1.3.0

classitems.description:
Register a plugin. Must implement at least a 'plugin' method that returns a
callable function.
classitems.name: use

params.name: cb
params.description: A callback function that will return any errors.

classitems.description:
The internal Event Emitter used by the running BrowserSync instance (if there is one).
You can use this to emit your own events, such as changed files, logging etc.
classitems.name: emitter

classitems.description: This method will close any running server, stop file watching & exit the current process.
classitems.name: exit

classitems.description:
BrowserSync can watch your files as you work. Changes you make will either
be injected into the page (CSS & images) or will cause all browsers to do
a full-page refresh. See [isaacs's minimatch](https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch) for more information on glob patterns.
classitems.name: files

classitems.description:
File watching options that get passed along to [Gaze](https://github.com/shama/gaze). Check out the [properties](https://github.com/shama/gaze#properties)
section of their docs to see which options they support.
for availbable options
classitems.name: watchOptions

classitems.description: Use the built-in static server for basic HTML/JS/CSS websites.
classitems.name: server

classitems.description: Proxy an EXISTING vhost. BrowserSync will wrap your existing url and provide a different one to use.
classitems.name: proxy

classitems.description: Enable https for localhost development. **Note:** Proxy and Tunnel not currently supported.
classitems.name: https

classitems.description:
Some features of BrowserSync (such as `xip` & `tunnel`) require an internet connection, but if you're
working offline, you can reduce start-up time by setting this option to `false`
classitems.name: online

classitems.description:
Decide which URL to open automatically when BrowserSync starts. Defaults to "local" if none set.
Can be true, "local", "external" or "tunnel"
classitems.name: open

classitems.description:
Requires an internet connection - useful for services such as [Typekit](https://typekit.com/)
as it allows you to configure domains such as `*.xip.io` in your kit settings
classitems.name: xip

classitems.description: The small pop-over notifications in the browser are not always needed/wanted.
classitems.name: notify

classitems.description: Whether to minify client script, or not.
classitems.name: minify
